editorialSummary.text: Informal hotel featuring relaxed quarters & an outdoor pool, plus a cafe & a gym, both open 24/7.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at this luxurious hotel, and it was truly a delightful experience. Located in a posh and upscale area, the hotel is easily accessible and surrounded by great dining and shopping options, adding to the overall convenience and charm of the stay.

From the moment I arrived, I was impressed by the elegance of the interiors and the warm hospitality of the staff. The rooms were spotlessly clean, well-furnished, and offered all the modern amenities needed for a comfortable stay. The attention to detail in housekeeping and room service was commendable.

The food was another highlight – delicious, well-prepared, and full of flavor. Whether it was breakfast or a late-night snack, everything tasted fresh and satisfying. The staff was extremely helpful, polite, and attentive, always ready to assist with a smile and ensure that guests feel at home.

Overall, the combination of luxury, great location, and outstanding service made my stay a memorable one. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a premium stay with top-notch hospitality. I will definitely be choosing this hotel again for my future visits.

text.text: Our stay at the Hyatt Place was fantastic! The service was excellent, and we felt really safe during our visit. When we realized we had lost our gold bracelet, the staff was incredibly helpful. They checked both the breakfast area and our room, ultimately finding the bracelet on the floor. They promptly sent us a photograph of it and ensured we received it back upon our return. We were truly impressed by their commitment to guest safety and service quality! Highly recommend this hotel!

text.text:
Very Disappointing Experience at Hyatt Place, Banjara Hills

Currently staying here and had a shocking experience at their cafeteria restaurant—ordered evening tea and found milk packet plastic cut out floating in it. Absolutely unacceptable for a hotel of this standard. There were cockroaches running in the roof top bar as well.

Hygiene and basic quality checks seem to be completely missing. We expect far better from a brand like Hyatt. This is not what we’re paying for. Very disappointing.

text.text:
We stayed at Hyatt for a family trip, and our overall experience was excellent. During breakfast, the staff approached us three times to check if we needed anything, and even the chef personally came to inquire about the food and our stay experience. The team was courteous and attentive throughout our visit.

We stayed in Room #110, and the housekeeping service was prompt and efficient. When we requested for the sofa to be made into an extra bed, the housekeeping staff responded quickly and completed the task without delay. Room service was also fast and satisfactory.

At the time of checkout, we requested help with our luggage by calling the housekeeping number, and a lady promptly arrived at our room to assist. To our pleasant surprise, we met her again at the reception—she was very polite and kind, though unfortunately, I don’t recall her name.

Thank you to the entire Hyatt team for making our stay a memorable one.

One suggestion: If space permits, it would be great to have a dedicated kids’ zone or activity area where children can play and enjoy.
Thanks
Amit Pandey

text.text:
Had convened a roundtable consultation here, and unfortunately, the experience was far below expectations. Our organization has been organizing events at various Hyatt properties across India, and this was by far the most disappointing.

The sales team was quite misleading. Initially, they tried charging extra for the hall over and above the cost of food per person, citing that the designated venue is only provided with a minimum guarantee of 40 guests - (gracious enough to allow us to host our event at the property, despite not meeting that number). Ironically, when we visited the venue a day before the event, the designated space could barely accommodate 25 people in a roundtable setup. There was hardly any room to move, and the placement of the screen, projector, and backdrop was poorly planned. The podium couldn’t even be accommodated.

The sales team also insisted on shifting our group of 30–35 guests to the restaurant for lunch instead of serving it in the foyer area, citing concerns about food wastage. After a lot of back-and-forth communication, they eventually agreed to serve lunch at the foyer of the venue (Grateful!)

While Hyatt is known for its hospitality, Hyatt Place Hyderabad was a letdown in both planning and service. Would not recommend this property for professional events.

It was an amazing experience , the hotel itself is beautiful and refined, the location is very convenient, you can access to the city very quickly, it has a delicious restaurant which serves Indian food of course, we tried few of the dishes and I can say the taste of them was very nice; in the evening they have a due performing traditional songs, you can enjoy this while having dinner, believe me it is magical when you come from another country get to see this.

text.text:
Absolutely Horrible Stay – Feels Like a Haunted Dungeon

I don’t usually leave reviews, but I feel morally obligated to warn others about this place. Staying at Amrutha Castle was hands down one of the most disgusting, disappointing, and creepy hotel experiences I’ve ever had in my life.

From the second you step in, the place gives off the most depressing, haunted-house energy.

Basic amenities? Forget about it.

No water bottle in the room.

No kettle.

No door mat.

NO exhaust fan in the bathroom (get ready to bathe in a steam chamber).

No shower or rinse area near the swimming pool—because apparently hygiene is optional here.

The management? A joke. Completely clueless, unprofessional, and seem to operate in their own world of apathy. It’s almost like they enjoy watching guests suffer. Zero sense of hospitality.

Honestly, the whole place reeks of negligence. It’s the kind of hotel that makes you want to shower twice after checking out—once to wash off the filth, and once to wash off the regret of booking it in the first place.

This stay wasn’t just bad. It was a waste of money, time, and sanity. If you’re even thinking about staying here, DON’T. Save your money and your soul. You’ve been warned.

text.text:
This place is an absolute disaster. I booked a stay here last month expecting a decent experience, but what I got was a dirty, neglected, and poorly maintained hotel that shouldn't be in business.

The room was filthy, with mold on the walls, stains on the furniture, and a patched-up sofa that was falling apart. The bed was unusable—springs sticking out, zero support, and downright unsafe. You could genuinely hurt your back sleeping on it.

Nothing in the room worked—the TV was dead, the landline was non-functional, and there was no drinking water or kettle provided. The bathroom was even worse—no dry area, no mat, no exhaust fan, and everything looked like it hadn’t been cleaned properly in months.

The staff were rude and unhelpful. They had no clue what was going on and weren’t interested in helping either. I asked for plates to eat food I ordered from outside and was told flat out: “We don’t give plates unless you order from our kitchen.” Who does that in the hospitality business?

The first room they gave me on the second floor looked like something from a medieval prison. I’ve honestly never seen anything like it in a hotel.

This is supposed to be part of the Country Club network, and as a long-time member, I’m shocked and disappointed. The quality has hit rock bottom.

Do yourself a favor—don’t book here. This place will ruin your holiday. There are far better hotels in the same price range nearby. Avoid this dump completely.

text.text:
I had one of the worst experiences of my life staying at Amrutha Castle. I checked in last month, and what I encountered was nothing short of a nightmare.

The room was in a terrible condition—dirty, moldy, stained, and filled with patched-up furniture that looked like it belonged in a junkyard. The sofa was torn, and the bed springs were broken, posing a real risk of injury (seriously, it felt dangerous for the spine). The landline didn’t work, and neither did the TV.

The bathroom was a horror show. No separate shower area, no dry area, no floor mat, no exhaust fan, and not even basic amenities like a kettle or drinking water. Everything looked old, neglected, and unhygienic.

The staff? That’s another disaster. Completely unprofessional, unresponsive, and downright rude. I was shocked when they refused to provide plates for outside food, saying: “We only give plates if you order food from us. Bye.” That’s the level of service.

Initially, I was given a room on the second floor—it honestly felt like a prison cell from Game of Thrones. (You can check the photos online—it’s unbelievable that this place calls itself a hotel, let alone part of the Country Club.)

I’ve been a Country Club member for 10 years, and this is by far the worst experience I’ve ever had with the vacation club. It’s embarrassing that this property is even affiliated with them.

If you care about your health, hygiene, and peace of mind—do not bring your family or friends here. This is not a hotel, it’s a dungeon masquerading as one. Stay far away.

Good hotel (rooms, ambience, cafe, location etc). Satisfied with the experience here.
I got the business room and it was very comfortable with good views outside.
Parking was plenty in the basement, they've valet and they took care of parking the car in their basement. However seems they've limited staff for valet (may be premier next door has more staff).
The TV in the room was a sore to the eye - very small. It's like a computer monitor. Not ok for the price paid for the room.
There was continuous hot water but it could be hotter.
Special mention to the staff - Nisha and Swapna for taking care at the reception and cafe.

text.text:
I stayed at Redfox Hotel, Hyderabad recently and was quite underwhelmed by the experience. For a room tariff of Rs. 7500 per night, I expected a much higher standard in terms of both service and facilities. Unfortunately, the hotel didn’t live up to that expectation.

The room, while decently sized, lacked attention to detail. The cleanliness wasn’t up to the mark, the linens felt worn out, and the bathroom amenities were basic at best. There was a sense that the space hadn’t been refreshed or maintained well, which was disappointing given the premium pricing.

Overall, the stay didn’t feel like it offered good value for money. With just a bit more care and improvement in upkeep, it could be a decent option, but as it stands, I wouldn’t choose to stay here again unless significant changes are made.

text.text:
A Fantastic Stay with One Major Flaw
My recent visit to Pragati resort was, for the most part, absolutely fantastic. The resort is impeccably clean and well-maintained, with a strong focus on hygiene that was noticeable from the moment we arrived. The sheer amount of space is a huge plus, with beautiful parks and grounds that are perfect for leisurely strolls.
The accommodations were great. Our room was very spacious, and the room service was prompt and efficient. The washrooms, in particular, were the best I've seen at a resort—spotless and well-designed.
However, the food was a major disappointment and the one significant drawback of our stay. It was a complete letdown. There was a noticeable lack of variety, and what was available simply didn't have any flavor. Considering the high quality of everything else, the food was a shocking and frustrating experience. It really wasn't worth the price and left us feeling quite let down.

However, the food was a major disappointment and the one significant drawback of our stay. It was a complete letdown. There was a noticeable lack of variety, and what was available simply didn't have any flavor. Considering the high quality of everything else, the food was a shocking and frustrating experience. It really wasn't worth the price and left us feeling quite let down.

text.text:
We went for family vacation. We took premium room called Lagoon-2. Room was very spatial but two single beds. If toddlers travel with parents who can’t sleep alone without elders don’t like it at all.They will not join the beds as well. Service is not good. If you ask for anything they won’t serve instead they will forget and we too should. Another thing is Go-cart vehicles will be there roaming to drop check in and check out  customers. It was raining but they did not allow to get in with child , though we requested. They might have rules and restrictions but in such situations they should have minimum courtesy to help customers to reach their rooms.
Food was very bad. Not at all worthy. They keep very less varieties in lunch and dinner. In Breakfast nothing was tasty and on time, we need to stand long for Dosa if you want, and no guarantee how they taste. Totally the situation was like they are doing some favour to us.
Instead of all these unacceptable things, there are good things like : beautiful nature, nice water pools, eye loving greenery.. it’s awesome to walk on green meadows of nature..early morning weather and birds chirping makes mind very calm and happy..

editorialSummary.text: Glam hotel featuring lake views, a spa & an outdoor pool, plus 3 restaurants, 2 bars & a nightclub.

text.text:
I had high expectations from The Park Hyderabad, but the experience turned out to be disappointing. From the start, the vibe felt off – the lobby begins on the 3rd floor and lacked the welcoming feel I expected. The reception had all new faces who seemed inexperienced, which didn’t help.

The hotel’s design feels flawed. The swimming pool is placed right next to the dining area, which makes swimming uncomfortable and also raises concerns about diners accidentally dropping things into the pool. My room had a bathtub with no proper drainage, so water spilled into the room. The only good part was the cleaning staff on the 8th floor who kept cleaning up the mess – though it clearly seemed like a daily extra burden for them due to poor planning.

The passages were dimly lit, there was no proper gym, and the balcony had no view. While some of the 3rd-floor staff were decent, the bar staff mocked customer choices – something I’d never expect in a 5-star hotel. The overall vibe felt more like a casual hangout spot rather than a premium hospitality experience.

Not the luxury stay I had hoped for. Management really needs to address these issues.

text.text:
My stay at Hilton Hyderabad Hitech City was truly exceptional. The hotel offers beautifully designed, spacious rooms with impressive views that add to the charm of the experience. The atmosphere is positive and calming, making it a perfect place to unwind whether you're traveling for business or leisure.

The hospitality here is top-notch , the staff are courteous, attentive, and go out of their way to make your stay comfortable. A highlight of the experience was the elaborate breakfast spread  both wide in variety and excellent in quality. The in-house dining also delivers consistently good food.

Overall, this is an excellent hotel with all the essentials: luxurious rooms, outstanding service, and a warm, welcoming environment. Highly recommended!

text.text:
Exceptional Hospitality – Feels Like a Home Away from Home

This is my fourth stay at Trident Hyderabad, and each time I am left amazed by the warmth, professionalism, and genuine care of the entire team. I came here for my family member’s treatment at AGI, and staying at Trident has always made a challenging time so much more comfortable and reassuring.

The staff are truly outstanding – from the warm welcome at check-in to the attentive service throughout the stay, they never fail to make me feel cared for. A very special mention must go to the breakfast team, who went above and beyond by thoughtfully packing food for my parents every single day with so much care and consideration. These small gestures, done with a big heart, reflect the spirit of true hospitality.

The rooms are immaculate, the food is excellent, and the atmosphere is both peaceful and uplifting – exactly what one needs during such visits. What sets Trident apart, however, is the people – their kindness and dedication turn every stay into a memorable experience.

Thank you, Trident Hyderabad, for once again making me feel at home. I look forward to returning, not just for the comfort, but for the incredible team that defines this place. 🌸

editorialSummary.text: Elegant rooms in an upscale hotel featuring 4 restaurants, an outdoor pool & a beauty salon.

text.text:
At first, I was a bit disappointed with my stay at Taj Krishna — my room didn’t have a bathtub, the view wasn’t as impressive as I’d hoped, and the work desk wasn’t very functional.

That said, the rest of the stay more than made up for it. The staff were warm and welcoming, the swimming pool was large and inviting, and the jacuzzi worked perfectly. Breakfast had a great spread and the service felt very well trained. The property seemed small at first glance but turned out to be more spacious than I expected.

One small downside was the bar area staff — they weren’t as polished or attentive as the rest of the team and felt a bit hit-or-miss, which was surprising in an otherwise well-run hotel.

Overall, a comfortable stay with classic Taj hospitality. Would recommend.

text.text:
From the moment I arrived, I was thoroughly impressed by the elegance and grandeur of the hotel building. The architecture seamlessly blends classic sophistication with modern luxury, creating a stunning first impression.
Inside, the aesthetic is equally captivating. Every space—from the lobby to the hallways and rooms—has been thoughtfully designed with an eye for detail. The interiors are warm, refined, and filled with character.
One of the standout features for me was the artwork throughout the hotel. The carefully curated paintings on the walls added a cultural and artistic depth that elevated the overall ambiance.
The staff were consistently professional, courteous, and genuinely welcoming. Whether it was the front door guards, front desk or housekeeping everyone went out of their way to ensure a comfortable and memorable stay. Their warmth and attentiveness truly set this hotel apart.

But unfortunately, the breakfast service on 03-08-2025 fell well below the mark.
Despite the elegant setting, the service was disorganized and inattentive. We waited an unreasonably long time just to be seated.
On buffet, some items were also cold and out of stock. Waiters were less in required number. We had to ask multiple times for puris and our order of dosa and uttapam from live counter-things that should be readily available at this level of service.  On sensing we are being irritated on level of service, incharge Mr. Sharath took interest in serving our order before things go awry.  I sensed they are ill prepared to serve breakfast in case of full occupancy of hotel.
For a hotel of this caliber, I expected efficiency, warmth, and attention to serve. Instead, it felt more like an over-burdened buffet than a luxury experience. Management should seriously reconsider staff training and supervision during breakfast hours, as this experience may leave lasting negative impression on an otherwise beautiful property.

Overall I If you’re looking for a place that combines architectural beauty, average breakfast service, and thoughtfully designed interiors, this hotel is a good choice.

Room & Cleanliness
The rooms were clean and functional, offering a no-frills, basic setup ideal for travelers seeking simplicity and comfort. While the decor was minimal, everything was well-maintained and tidy, making for a pleasant stay.

Location & Accessibility:
The hotel’s location was spot-on for exploring the city, with major attractions and commercial areas within easy reach. However, being in a busy part of town, guests should be prepared to deal with traffic noise and congestion throughout the day.

Dining Experience:
Breakfast was a highlight, offering a generous spread of cuisines to suit various tastes. The South Indian options stood out, especially the soft, fluffy idlis paired with a spicy and tangy chutney that was absolutely delicious. The variety and quality of food made for a satisfying start to the day.

Bathroom & Amenities:
Bathrooms were hygienic and thoughtfully equipped with essential toiletries. Everything was placed conveniently, and cleanliness was clearly a priority, contributing to a comfortable and hassle-free experience.

text.text:
I recently visited Hotel Marigold and, while the stay was generally pleasant, I noticed something that left a lasting impression—not in a good way.

After meals were served to guests, there was often a large quantity of leftover food. Unfortunately, instead of finding a more thoughtful solution, the hotel staff simply threw all the remaining food into the dustbin. It was disheartening to see so much good food go to waste, especially when there are many people in need who would benefit greatly from such generosity.

In today’s world, where hunger is still a major issue, it would be far more meaningful if establishments like Hotel Marigold partnered with local charities, food banks, or community shelters to donate the surplus food. Not only would this reduce waste, but it would also show a sense of social responsibility and compassion.

Hotel Marigold has the potential to set a positive example. The food is good, the service is efficient—but making a small change in how leftovers are handled could elevate the hotel's reputation and impact the community positively.

I truly hope they consider this in the future. A little effort can go a long way in making the world a better place.

text.text:
This was my second visit to Leonia  the first was for our office annual event and the second for a corporate meeting.

The property has its positives: it is close to nature with plenty of greenery, a huge swimming pool, and spacious areas that make for a pleasant evening walk. The resort is vast, making it convenient to host large meetings or corporate gatherings. Rooms are also quite big, which is a plus.

However, maintenance is a major concern. Being an old property, the furniture and fixtures are not well maintained. Bathrooms in the rooms were not clean (something even my friends experienced), and the common restrooms were in poor condition rusted taps, broken fittings, and visible yellow stains.

Food quality was disappointing, with hygiene standards far below expectations.

Overall, this place has great potential and could be one of the best resorts in Hyderabad for long stays or corporate events if cleanliness, maintenance, and food quality are given proper attention.

text.text: We visited Hyderabad from America and wanted to ensure our stay was comfortable while we spent time with family. As Marriott Bonvoy Reward members, we chose the Hyderabad Marriott, and it didn't disappoint. The concierge team at the Courtyard Marriott was extremely helpful in transferring us to the Marriott. The guestrooms were quite nice, and the food was excellent. Both the breakfast buffet and in-room dining were top-notch. The staff at the Okra restaurant—Madhusheee, Tamisha, Mohan, and Priyankar—took great care of us. The next time I visit Hyderabad, I will definitely return to the Marriott.

text.text:
I spent a few days at the Hyderabad Marriott Hotel before my flight, and it was exactly what I needed.
While the hotel is not new, the service was truly exceptional—the staff went out of their way to help, and even prepared non-spicy meals for me daily. The massage was also excellent.

I came from a larger, flashier hotel but found this one much cozier and more relaxing. The view of the lake from the lobby brought a welcome sense of calm after time in the chaos of the city. I mostly stayed in the hotel to work, and it was a perfect setting.

If you’re looking to rest and be well taken care of, I highly recommend it.

My husband complained about a hair in the stir-fried veggies; instead of replacing the dish, the staff merely removed the hair and brought back the same plate. We called the staff to get the asset locker fixed, but their technician arrived an hour later, only after we had repeatedly called to remind them. The property itself is stunning — an architectural masterpiece that blends traditional elegance with modern comfort. My room was beautifully appointed, with exquisite decor, top-notch amenities, and a view that was simply breathtaking.

Dining at The Leela was a culinary delight, with every meal crafted to perfection. The breakfast buffet offered a wide variety of fresh, delicious options, and the service was consistently excellent.

Thank you to everyone at The Leela Palace for making my stay so special. I look forward to returning and highly recommend this palace of hospitality to anyone seeking an extraordinary stay

text.text:
I recently stayed at The Leela, Hyderabad for two nights, and the experience was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment we arrived, the hospitality truly stood out. Since we were traveling with a toddler, the staff kindly escorted us straight to our room and completed the check-in formalities there, a thoughtful gesture that saved us time and made us feel instantly at ease.

The rooms were spacious, elegant, and very comfortable. The food throughout our stay was excellent, and we especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet, which offered a wide variety of delicious options. Room service was prompt and efficient.

What touched us most was the attention given to our child. The team had thoughtfully left a teddy bear, crayons, and a coloring book in the room for our 18-month-old, which made us feel genuinely welcomed and cared for.

A special thanks to Manisha and Amisha, who were incredibly kind and helpful throughout our stay. Their warmth and attentiveness truly elevated the entire experience.

I highly recommend The Leela, Hyderabad to anyone visiting the city, especially families with young children. It’s a perfect blend of luxury, comfort, and heartfelt hospitality.

text.text:
Comfortable, Kid-Friendly Stay with Great Location & Staff.

Stayed here for a week with my wife and two kids( 7 and 3 year old) and had a genuinely pleasant experience. The location is a big plus , almost everything important is within 15–20 minutes: Hitech City, railway station, Toli Chowki, Charminar, etc. The area around the hotel is vibrant, surrounded by sweet shops, dosa/idli vendors, pan stalls, Masqati dairy, Chinese joints, Paradise, Shah Ghouse, and other major restaurants.

A huge bonus was that Hussain Sagar Lake is just a 15-minute walk from the hotel, right next to the new Secretariat. We strolled there every night, very peaceful and enjoyable. You can also take a Rapido auto for around ₹50 if you don’t feel like walking.

The staff was absolutely amazing.  Noor and Dinesh were super helpful and always available.  Special thanks to Safeera and her colleague from housekeeping – they were so friendly with our kids, letting them play in the hallway without any complaints and even joining in sometimes. It made a big difference, especially during long days indoors. The two cleaning ladies were also wonderful, kept our room spotless every day and stayed in touch with my wife and kids with warm, friendly conversations.

The housekeeping, room service, and front desk teams were all top-notch. There is a 24/7 front desk, and security was always present. The lift is a little old-school, but it works fine. Rooms are decent-sized and comfortable for the price.

Only Downside: the restaurant, which is managed separately, had a few staff members and a manager who weren’t very hospitable, rude over small things like asking for an extra plate/bowls.  But the hotel staff more than made up for that experience.

Overall, this was a very family-friendly stay, and we made some great memories here. Will definitely be coming back. For any reservations or hotel-related issues help, reach out to Vikrant , he is your guy, super helpful and responsive.

A huge bonus was that Hussain Sagar Lake is just a 15-minute walk from the hotel, right next to the new Secretariat. We strolled there every night, very peaceful and enjoyable. You can also take a Rapido auto for around ₹50 if you don’t feel like walking.

The staff was absolutely amazing.  Noor and Dinesh were super helpful and always available.  Special thanks to Safeera and her colleague from housekeeping – they were so friendly with our kids, letting them play in the hallway without any complaints and even joining in sometimes. It made a big difference, especially during long days indoors. The two cleaning ladies were also wonderful, kept our room spotless every day and stayed in touch with my wife and kids with warm, friendly conversations.

The housekeeping, room service, and front desk teams were all top-notch. There is a 24/7 front desk, and security was always present. The lift is a little old-school, but it works fine. Rooms are decent-sized and comfortable for the price.

Only Downside: the restaurant, which is managed separately, had a few staff members and a manager who weren’t very hospitable, rude over small things like asking for an extra plate/bowls.  But the hotel staff more than made up for that experience.

Overall, this was a very family-friendly stay, and we made some great memories here. Will definitely be coming back. For any reservations or hotel-related issues help, reach out to Vikrant , he is your guy, super helpful and responsive.

text.text:
Hyatt Place Hyderabad Banjara Hills is a modern and stylish hotel located in the heart of Hyderabad's upscale Banjara Hills neighborhood. The hotel boasts a contemporary design and sleek aesthetics, with a glass façade and a well-manicured lawn that provides a welcoming and refreshing ambiance to guests.

The hotel has a total of 147 well-appointed rooms and suites, which are equipped with all the modern amenities and comforts to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. The rooms are spacious and elegantly designed, with plush bedding, large windows, and modern furnishings.

One of the standout features of Hyatt Place Hyderabad Banjara Hills is its commitment to sustainability and reducing its carbon footprint. The hotel has implemented several eco-friendly measures, including energy-efficient lighting and appliances, water-saving fixtures, and a waste management system that recycles and composts waste.

In terms of dining options, the hotel has a variety of on-site restaurants and bars that offer a range of international and local cuisine. The Gallery Kitchen is the hotel's signature restaurant, which serves a complimentary hot breakfast buffet each morning, while the 24/7 Gallery Market offers grab-and-go meals and snacks throughout the day. The hotel also has a rooftop lounge, which provides panoramic views of the city and serves cocktails and light bites in the evening.

Other amenities at Hyatt Place Hyderabad Banjara Hills include a fitness center, an outdoor pool, and a business center, making it an ideal choice for both leisure and business travelers. The hotel also offers meeting and event spaces that can accommodate up to 250 guests, making it a popular choice for conferences and weddings.

Overall, Hyatt Place Hyderabad Banjara Hills is a stylish and modern hotel that offers a comfortable and sustainable stay in the heart of Hyderabad. With its contemporary design, commitment to sustainability, and range of amenities, it is an excellent choice for travelers looking for a luxurious and eco-friendly stay in the city.

Amrutha Castle in Hyderabad is a unique boutique hotel designed to resemble a medieval European castle, making it a standout choice for travelers seeking a distinctive stay. Located near Hussain Sagar Lake, it offers a blend of old-world charm and modern amenities. The architecture, with its turrets and stone walls, creates a fairy-tale-like ambiance. Rooms are cozy and designed with a classic touch, while the rooftop pool and in-house dining options enhance the guest experience.

While the aesthetic is captivating, the hotel’s upkeep and service have received mixed reviews. Some guests appreciate its central location and themed design, while others note the need for better maintenance and improved customer service. It's an ideal choice for those looking for a visually striking hotel with a medieval theme, but setting realistic expectations about service quality is advised.

text.text:
Title: “Aesthetic Bliss at the Heartfelt Inn”

🌟🌟🌟

As a discerning traveler, I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Heartfelt Inn—a hidden gem nestled in the heart of the city. Let me share my experience with you:

Ambiance: From the moment I stepped into the lobby, I was enveloped in an ethereal ambiance. Soft lighting, soothing colors, and carefully curated decor set the tone for a tranquil retreat. The lobby’s lush indoor plants added a touch of nature, instantly calming my senses.

Rooms: The well-furnished rooms were a sanctuary of comfort. Plush beds with crisp linens, tasteful artwork, and thoughtfully placed accent pieces created an inviting space. The large windows framed picturesque views of the city skyline, allowing natural light to flood the room during the day.

Aesthetic Vibes: Each room had its unique charm—a blend of modern elegance and cozy warmth. The minimalist design, combined with subtle pops of color, evoked a sense of serenity. I found myself appreciating the attention to detail—the textured wallpaper, the vintage-style lamps, and the locally crafted wooden furniture.

Bathroom Delight: The ensuite bathroom was equally delightful. Clean lines, gleaming tiles, and a rain shower made me feel pampered. The eco-friendly toiletries were a thoughtful touch, aligning perfectly with the hotel’s commitment to sustainability.

Common Areas: The Heartfelt Inn’s common areas were an extension of its aesthetic allure. The rooftop garden, adorned with fairy lights, offered a magical spot for stargazing. And the cozy library corner—complete with plush armchairs and a crackling fireplace—beckoned bookworms like me.

Service: The staff’s warm hospitality added to the overall experience. They anticipated my needs, whether it was a late-night cup of chamomile tea or arranging a taxi for my city exploration.

In summary, the Heartfelt Inn is more than just a place to rest—it’s an oasis of beauty and tranquility. Whether you’re a solo traveler seeking solitude or a couple celebrating a special occasion, this 3-star gem will leave you with cherished memories.

Outstanding Stay at Red Fox by Lemon Tree Hotels, Hyderabad

I had an absolutely wonderful experience during my stay at Red Fox, Hyderabad. From the moment I checked in, the hospitality, cleanliness, and attention to detail were exceptional.

A special word of appreciation for the amazing Housekeeping team – Manoj and Krishna – who ensured my room was always spotless and comfortable. Their efficiency and friendliness made a big difference to my stay.

I'd also like to thank Pavan & Rahul from the management team, whose presence and professionalism were reassuring and proactive. They ensured everything ran smoothly.

And finally, a heartfelt thanks to Rani at the front desk – welcoming, courteous, and always ready to help. Her warmth truly made me feel at home.

Highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Hyderabad. Great service, great team, and a truly memorable stay. Will definitely be coming back.

— Dr. Sagar Kapadia

text.text:
_A Luxurious Retreat: The Park Hotel, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad Review_

I recently had the pleasure of staying at The Park Hotel in Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, and I must say, it was an exceptional experience. From the moment I arrived, I was treated to unparalleled hospitality, impeccable service, and a truly luxurious atmosphere.

_Warm Hospitality_

The staff at The Park Hotel went above and beyond to make me feel welcome. The front desk team was efficient and courteous, while the concierge service was knowledgeable and helpful. Every interaction with the staff was a testament to their commitment to excellence.

_Impeccable Service_

The service at The Park Hotel was seamless and attentive. Room service was prompt, and the housekeeping team ensured that my room was spotless and well-maintained throughout my stay. The staff's attention to detail was impressive, and they anticipated my every need.

_Cleanliness and Hygiene_

The Park Hotel's commitment to cleanliness and hygiene is evident in every aspect of the hotel. The rooms, public areas, and dining spaces were all immaculate, with a clear emphasis on maintaining the highest standards of hygiene.

_Tasty Cuisine_

The food at The Park Hotel was a culinary delight. The breakfast spread was extensive, with a wide range of options to suit every taste. The à la carte menu offered an array of delicious dishes, and the room service menu was equally impressive. Every meal was a testament to the chef's skill and creativity.

_Beautiful Ambience_

The Park Hotel's ambience is its crowning glory. The beautifully landscaped gardens, the elegant lobby, and the tastefully decorated rooms all come together to create a luxurious oasis in the heart of the city. The hotel's design is a perfect blend of modernity and tradition, making it a true gem.

_Additional Amenities_

The Park Hotel offers an array of amenities, including a state-of-the-art fitness center, a luxurious spa, and an outdoor pool. The business center is well-equipped, making it an ideal choice for corporate travelers.

_In Conclusion_

The Park Hotel, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, is a true gem. With its exceptional hospitality, impeccable service, cleanliness, tasty food, and beautiful ambience, it is an ideal choice for both business and leisure travelers. I left with fond memories and a deep appreciation for this luxurious retreat. If you're looking for a truly unforgettable experience, look no further than The Park Hotel.

Located in Hyderabad, THE GRAND PLAZA A BOUTIQUE HOTEL is connected to a shopping centre. Ravindra Bharathi and Birla Science Museum are cultural highlights, and travellers looking to shop may want to visit Abids and Laad Baazar. Krazi Chiks and BM Birla Science Centre are also worth visiting. Spend some time exploring the area's activities, including outlet shopping and winery tours.
What's nearby

1. A.P. State Museum - 3 min walk
2. AP State Archaeology Museum - 3 min walk
3. Dargah Yousufain - 17 min walk
4. Lumbini Park - 8 min drive
5. Birla Mandir Temple - 9 min drive
Getting around

1. Hyderabad Lakdikapul Station - 16 min walk
2  Hyderabad (HYD-Rajiv Gandhi Intl.) - 60 min drive

3-star hotel connected to the convention centre
THE GRAND PLAZA A BOUTIQUE HOTEL provides amenities, such as a free breakfast buffet and dry cleaning/laundry services. Stay connected with free in-room WiFi.
You'll also enjoy the following perks during your stay:
Free self-parking
A lift, luggage storage and concierge services
Tour/ticket information, a 24-hour front desk and free newspapers

All 35 rooms offer amenities such as free WiFi.
Other amenities include:

Strict adherence of check-out and check-in time only to their advantage and not to ours. Night dinner we had which was not prepared fresh but warmed up lunch items only. Overall ourstay was really a memorable one but in the wrong sense.

text.text:
Trident Hotel Hyderabad is a luxurious hotel located in the heart of the bustling city of Hyderabad, India. The hotel offers a perfect blend of luxury, comfort, and convenience to its guests. The hotel is located in the Hitec City, which is a hub of business and technology, making it a perfect choice for business travelers. Here is a detailed review of the hotel, including building aesthetics, carbon footprint, and physical description.

The building aesthetics of the Trident Hotel Hyderabad are a perfect blend of contemporary and traditional Indian design. The hotel's exterior is impressive with a combination of glass, steel, and white marble that gives it a modern and sleek look. The interiors are elegant and sophisticated, featuring intricate Indian motifs and textures in warm, earthy colors. The hotel's design showcases a deep respect for the local heritage and culture, and it reflects in every corner of the hotel.

In terms of carbon footprint, the hotel has taken significant steps to reduce its environmental impact. The hotel has implemented a comprehensive recycling program, which includes recycling waste, using recycled materials, and reducing water and energy consumption. The hotel has also installed solar panels to generate electricity, and it has implemented a water conservation program that includes using low-flow faucets and shower-heads.

The physical description of the hotel is impressive, with 323 luxurious rooms and suites that are spacious and elegantly designed. The rooms are equipped with all modern amenities, including air conditioning, LED TV, tea and coffee maker, and mini-bar. The bathrooms are fitted with modern fixtures and have a separate shower and bathtub. The hotel has a beautiful outdoor pool, a fitness center, and a spa that offers a range of rejuvenating treatments.

The hotel has three restaurants, including an all-day dining restaurant that serves international and local cuisine, a specialty Indian restaurant, and a bar that offers a range of cocktails and beverages. The hotel also has a bakery that serves a selection of fresh bread, pastries, and cakes.

The hotel's location is ideal for business travelers as it is close to the Hitec City, a hub of technology and business. The hotel offers a range of meeting and conference facilities that can accommodate up to 800 guests, making it an ideal venue for conferences, seminars, and corporate events.

In conclusion, the Trident Hotel Hyderabad is a luxurious hotel that offers a perfect blend of contemporary design and traditional Indian hospitality. The hotel has taken significant steps towards reducing its environmental impact, and it has implemented a range of sustainable practices. The physical description of the hotel is impressive, with luxurious rooms and suites, beautiful restaurants, and excellent meeting and conference facilities. If you're looking for a luxurious stay in Hyderabad, the Trident Hotel Hyderabad is an excellent choice.

text.text:
Taj Krishna Hyderabad is a luxurious 5-star hotel situated in the heart of the vibrant city of Hyderabad, India. With its rich history, impeccable service, and opulent surroundings, Taj Krishna has long been a symbol of elegance and hospitality in this bustling metropolis. In this comprehensive description, we will explore every facet of this exquisite hotel, from its history and architecture to its accommodations, dining options, amenities, and more.

History and Architecture

Taj Krishna Hyderabad, part of the iconic Taj Hotels Resorts and Palaces group, has a storied history that dates back to its opening in 1988. The hotel was designed by the renowned architect Edward Durell Stone, who was known for his modernist approach and signature style. The architecture of Taj Krishna seamlessly blends contemporary elements with traditional Indian design, creating a striking and inviting ambiance.

As you approach the hotel, you are greeted by a grand entrance that features a stunning facade adorned with intricate motifs and carvings inspired by the rich cultural heritage of Hyderabad. The lobby is a masterpiece in itself, with its soaring ceilings, marble floors, and magnificent chandeliers that cast a warm and welcoming glow upon arrival.

Accommodations

Taj Krishna Hyderabad offers a variety of accommodations, ranging from well-appointed rooms to luxurious suites, each designed to provide guests with the utmost comfort and relaxation. The rooms are tastefully decorated with a blend of modern amenities and traditional Indian decor, offering a serene oasis amidst the bustling city.

The Presidential Suite, a true gem of the hotel, is a sprawling, lavishly appointed space that exudes opulence. It boasts a private living room, a dining area, a spacious bedroom, and a marble-clad bathroom complete with a Jacuzzi. From the suite's large windows, guests can enjoy breathtaking views of the city skyline.

Dining

One of the highlights of a stay at Taj Krishna Hyderabad is the exquisite dining experience. The hotel boasts a variety of restaurants and bars that cater to diverse palates.

- Firdaus: Firdaus is the hotel's signature Indian restaurant, known for its authentic Hyderabadi cuisine. Guests can savor delectable biryanis, kebabs, and a range of other regional specialties in a regal setting.

- Golden Dragon: For those craving Chinese cuisine, Golden Dragon offers a menu of delectable dishes prepared by skilled chefs. The elegant decor and impeccable service complement the culinary experience.

- Encounters: Encounters is an all-day dining restaurant that serves a diverse range of international cuisines, making it a perfect choice for guests with varied tastes.

- Seasons Bar: The hotel's bar, Seasons, offers an extensive selection of spirits, wines, and cocktails, making it an ideal spot to unwind and socialize.

Amenities and Facilities

Taj Krishna Hyderabad ensures that guests have access to a wide array of amenities and facilities to enhance their stay. Some notable offerings include:

- Jiva Spa: The Jiva Spa is a tranquil haven where guests can indulge in rejuvenating spa treatments inspired by ancient Indian wellness traditions. The serene ambiance and skilled therapists create an oasis of relaxation.

- Fitness Center: The hotel features a state-of-the-art fitness center equipped with modern exercise equipment, allowing guests to maintain their fitness routines while away from home.

- Swimming Pool: The outdoor swimming pool is a perfect place to take a refreshing dip or lounge by the poolside while enjoying Hyderabad's pleasant weather.

- Event and Conference Facilities: Taj Krishna Hyderabad is equipped with extensive event and conference spaces, making it an ideal choice for business meetings, conferences, and social gatherings.

- Concierge Services: The dedicated concierge team is always ready to assist guests with various arrangements, including city tours, transportation, and reservations.

Location and Surroundings

text.text:
Exceptional Dining Experience at ITC Kohenur – Kudos to Sushanshu and Sonali

Our recent dinner experience at ITC Kohenur, Hyderabad, was truly memorable—thanks in large part to the outstanding service provided by Sushanshu and Sonali. From the moment we arrived, they extended warm, attentive hospitality, offering thoughtful recommendations that clearly reflected a deep understanding of the menu and its intricacies. Their professionalism and genuine enthusiasm elevated our entire experience.

The set menu itself was excellently curated, showcasing the chef’s finesse and attention to detail. Every dish was executed to perfection, both in presentation and taste. The quality of the ingredients and the harmony of flavors left a lasting impression.

The grandeur of the location, along with its refined ambience, adds a sense of occasion to every visit. There’s a subtle signature aroma used throughout the space that is truly blissful—adding an elegant sensory layer to the overall dining experience. The property is impeccably maintained, from the dining areas to the restrooms, which were notably spotless and fresh—a detail that reflects the hotel’s high standards of hygiene and guest care.

In all, ITC Kohenur continues to uphold its reputation for excellence, and with team members like Sushanshu and Saloni, the experience becomes all the more exceptional. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a fine dining experience in Hyderabad.

A Truly Premium Stay with Fantastic Service

Rating:★ ★ ★ ★ ★ (4.2/5)

Stay Details:4 nights in a Premium Room

I recently stayed at the hotel for four nights in one of their premium rooms, and the experience was exceptional from start to finish.

The most standout feature was the unparalleled service. The Manager and every single receptionist were incredibly helpful, attentive, and genuinely cared about ensuring a comfortable stay. A perfect example of this was on my first dat when there was some unexpected noise that was disrupting my rest.

I reported the issue to the Manager, and their response was immediate and impressive. They didn't just acknowledge it; they jumped into action  to resolve it. The situation was handled so professionally and efficiently that it was completely sorted out for the remainder of my stay. This kind of responsive and guest-centric service is what truly sets a 5-star experience apart.

Furthermore, the hotel's location is ideal . It's perfectly situated for both leisure and business, and most importantly, it's just a 5-minute walk from the Raidur Metro Station. This made exploring the city incredibly easy and convenient.

Overall, the combination of a premium, comfortable room, an unbeatable location, and most importantly, a staff that goes above and beyond, makes this hotel a top choice. I would not hesitate to return and highly recommend it to anyone visiting the city.

text.text:
Leonia Holistic Destination in Shamirpet, Hyderabad, Telangana, is truly a captivating retreat that offers an unparalleled blend of luxury, tranquility, and wellness. As someone who has had the pleasure of visiting this oasis, I can confidently say that it is an experience like no other.

Nestled amidst the serene landscapes of Shamirpet, Leonia Holistic Destination provides a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. The property boasts sprawling green gardens, picturesque lakes, and an overall ambiance that instantly puts one at ease.

The resort's accommodations are nothing short of impressive. From spacious rooms to lavish suites, each living space is tastefully designed with modern amenities and thoughtful touches. The blend of comfort and aesthetics creates an atmosphere of pure relaxation.

One of the highlights of Leonia is its focus on holistic well-being. The resort offers a wide array of wellness facilities, including a well-equipped gym, rejuvenating spa services, and yoga sessions that cater to guests of all ages and fitness levels. The holistic approach to health and wellness sets this destination apart and ensures a truly rejuvenating experience for guests.

Additionally, the resort boasts an impressive selection of dining options. From local delicacies to international cuisine, the restaurants serve up a delectable array of dishes to satisfy every palate. The culinary experience at Leonia is a true delight, leaving guests eager to savor each meal.

What truly sets Leonia Holistic Destination apart is its range of recreational activities. The property features an impressive water park, adventure sports, and various indoor games. It's the perfect destination for families, couples, and groups of friends looking for a mix of relaxation and excitement.

However, it's worth noting that during peak seasons, the resort can get quite crowded, affecting the overall tranquility. Also, some areas of the property may require a little maintenance to maintain its pristine appeal.

In conclusion, Leonia Holistic Destination is a must-visit for those seeking a luxurious escape with a focus on wellness and recreation. Whether you want to unwind in a serene setting, indulge in mouthwatering cuisine, or partake in thrilling activities, this destination has it all. While there might be a few minor drawbacks, the overall experience is bound to leave you with cherished memories of your stay in this enchanting haven.

text.text:
1.  Location: The Hyderabad Marriott Hotel is located in a prime area, right by the Hussain Sagar Lake, offering beautiful views of the water and the city. It's well connected to popular attractions, business districts, and major landmarks, making it convenient for both leisure and business travelers.

2.  Check-in Experience: The check-in process was smooth and efficient. The staff at the front desk were welcoming and professional.

3.  Room: The room was spacious, clean, and well-maintained. The bed was incredibly comfortable, offering a restful sleep after a long day. The décor was modern yet cozy, with all the amenities one would expect from a five-star hotel, including a minibar, flat-screen TV, and a work desk.

4. Dining: We had the opportunity to dine at their in-house Okra restaurant, and the food was excellent. The breakfast buffet was lavish, offering a wide variety of cuisines, including Indian, Continental, and Asian options. The live cooking stations were a nice touch, and the staff was attentive to dietary preferences.
Special thanks to Sara for serving us with utmost hospitality. As tea enthusiasts, we were pleasantly surprised by the quality of Masala tea. For dinner we tried Chicken Rogan Josh, it was very delicious. Its a highly recommended dish.

5. Service: The service throughout the hotel was top-notch. The staff were courteous, helpful, and always willing to go the extra mile. Whether it was housekeeping, restaurant staff (specially Sara), or concierge, everyone ensured our stay was comfortable.

6. Value for Money: While the hotel is on the pricier side, the level of service, luxury, and comfort offered makes it worth the cost. It is a great option for those looking to splurge a little for a premium experience in Hyderabad.

Overall Experience: Our stay at Hyderabad Marriott Hotel 31st August to 3rd September was very nice. We enjoyed the scenic location, the excellent service, and the relaxing ambiance. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Hyderabad, whether for business or leisure.

text.text:
Last year I completed over 30 flights, this gives you an idea of how many hotels I have recently stayed in.
This hotel has been by far the most hard work and stressful stay in 12 months.

Firstly, I was not able to charge items to my room. I went to reception to change this, the next day, still the same. Very frustrating. This then continued for the next day! Incredibly annoying and a display of the poor systems which they clearly have in place here.

Secondly, the transport. I asked the hotel to arrange a car for me to go to a shopping mall. They quoted me 30,000INR for a 12km round trip. Absolutely crazy.
Obviously, I then used Uber who charged me a total of 3,500INR. This hotel was X10 the amount of Uber. Absolutely embarrassing and poor customer care.

The following day I then asked them to quote me to use a driver for the whole day (200km trip) and they told me they don’t have any cars available. Understandable I suppose, but they were unwilling to organise me a car of any sort. Incredibly unhelpful.

To end on a positive, the hotel rooms are nice and clean, beds are very comfortable and the food was delicious.

I personally wouldn’t recommend this hotel and won’t be returning. Everything here is hard work and takes longer than it needs to.

I’m enjoying an extended stay at The Leela, Hyderabad—and it has been nothing short of extraordinary. The hospitality is gracious and seamless, the décor blends classical charm with modern comfort, and the experience exudes understated luxury at every turn.

The property is adorned with timeless originals by M.F. Husain—each piece a celebration of India’s artistic heritage that simply cannot be missed.

Culinary offerings are exceptional, and service is executed with warmth and finesse.

The Library Bar is a sanctuary for connoisseurs—don’t leave without trying the Negroni, masterfully crafted by Bhuwan, the resident mixologist. Truly exceptional service from Vinod and the entire staff.

A truly distinguished retreat.

text.text:
A Perfect Blend of Luxury and Efficiency: My Review of The Leela Hotel
Stepping into The Leela Hotel is an experience in itself – one that immediately conveys a sense of refined elegance and contemporary comfort. Having recently stayed there for a business trip, I can confidently say that this hotel is a top-tier choice for anyone seeking a seamless blend of luxury, convenience, and an environment conducive to productivity.
Unbeatable Location: Without a doubt, one of The Leela's most compelling assets is its prime location. Situated in a vibrant and easily accessible area, it offers incredible convenience for both business and leisure travelers. Whether you need to reach key business districts, major transportation hubs, or simply explore the city's attractions, the hotel's strategic positioning significantly cuts down on travel time and stress. This is a huge plus, especially when you're on a tight schedule.
Impeccably Maintained and Modern: What truly sets The Leela apart is its spotless presentation and remarkably new feel. From the moment you enter the lobby to the well-appointed guest rooms, everything exudes an air of pristine cleanliness and modern design. It's evident that the hotel is either very new or incredibly well-maintained, with contemporary furnishings, state-of-the-art amenities, and a fresh aesthetic that makes for a truly comfortable stay. This attention to detail contributes significantly to a sense of well-being and productivity.
Ideal for Business Meetings and Work: For business travelers, The Leela is an absolute godsend. The hotel's infrastructure and services are perfectly tailored for corporate needs. The meeting facilities are top-notch, offering a range of well-equipped rooms that can accommodate everything from intimate discussions to larger conferences. The seamless technology, professional staff, and comfortable setting ensure that your meetings run smoothly and efficiently. Furthermore, the in-room workspace is thoughtfully designed, providing a quiet and productive environment for catching up on emails, preparing presentations, or simply getting work done. High-speed internet is reliable, and the overall ambiance fosters focus and concentration.
In conclusion, The Leela Hotel is a shining example of a property that understands and caters to the needs of the discerning traveler. Its exceptional location, combined with its pristine condition and excellent business facilities, makes it an outstanding choice for business meetings and work-related stays. Beyond its practical advantages, the hotel also offers the kind of attentive service and luxurious touches that transform a simple business trip into a truly enjoyable experience. I highly recommend The Leela and look forward to my next stay.
